Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. John Jay Ferdon of San Francisco of the engagement of their daughter, Maggie Ferdon, to John Withrow Cooley, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel P. Cooley of West Hartford, Conn., and Nantucket, Mass. The couple plan a January wedding.

Miss Ferdon is the executive director of the Student/Sponsor Partnership, a nonprofit organization in New York that provides scholarships to inner-city students. She graduated from the Katherine Delmar Burke School and Vassar College, attended the New York University Institute of Fine Arts and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia University.

Her father, a partner in the law firm of Mills & Ferdon and the president of the San Francisco Law School, served as District Attorney in San Francisco and the president of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors. Miss Ferdon's mother, Nancy Crowell Ferdon, is a social worker in the Child Welfare Department of San Francisco.

Mr. Cooley, a vice president of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York, graduated from St. Paul's School in Concord, N.H., and magna cum laude from Yale College. He received an M.B.A. degree from N.Y.U. His father is an executive vice president of the Connecticut National Bank and is the senior credit officer of the bank and of the Hartford National Corporation. Mr. Cooley's grandfather the late Charles P. Cooley Jr. was the senior partner in Cooley & Company, a Hartford stockbrokerage, and a governor of the New York Stock Exchange.
